title: Art Movements and -isms
description:
An interdiscisplinary study of the arts, ideas and values in different societies and the extent to which these spread from one society to another. We will explore why and how the arts germinate, proliferate, evolve, hibernate, revive, and die. But, how far must art grow to be called a movement? Primary emphasis is on western art and its intersections with other societies, including
west influencing east and east influencing the west, particularly in the musical and visual arts. The movements and –isms students study will vary each time the course is taught.
